snippet: Low state test scores, released on Wednesday, provided a reminder that many of the candidates have yet to articulate far-reaching visions for the city’s schools.
abstract: Political Memo; low New York State test scores give New York City mayoral candidates easy political fodder to criticize Bloomberg administration's education policies, but also serve as a reminder that many of them have yet to articulate far-reaching visions for the city's schools, which serve 1.1 million children.
lead_paragraph: Low state test scores, released on Wednesday, provided a reminder that many of the candidates have yet to articulate far-reaching visions for the city’s schools.

headline.main: In Mayoral Race, Looking for Substance in Schools Conversation
headline.print_headline: Looking for Substance In Schools Conversation
